features: Fluid design and underwater protection. Beautifully designed to fit the contours of your hand while featuring IP68 underwater protection.
50MP and f/1.4, the widest smartphone aperture. Capture stunning photos in any light with 32x more focusing pixels, OIS, and the widest aperture available in a smartphone.
Blazing-fast 68W TurboPower charging. Get power for the entire day in less than 10 minutes of charging.
Borderless display + Dolby Atmos audio. Bring movies, shows, and video calls to life on a 6.6" display with an ultra-fast 144Hz refresh rate and multidimensional sound.
Performance powerhouse. Enjoy smoother gameplay, high-resolution videos, and lightning-fast file transfers with the MediaTek Dimensity 7030 chipset.
Unleash your phone with Ready For. Connect wirelessly to a TV to play mobile games, make video calls, and use your phone’s apps on a big screen.
Clean Android + moto gesture controls. Enjoy Android as it was intended, along with intuitive gestures and personalization options with My UX.
Unlocked for the freedom to choose your carrier.
In-box: Motorola Edge (2023), USB Cable, Guides, SIM tool
body.description: Style is everywhere on the new motorola edge. With a sleek, contoured endless-edge design, it’s as beautiful as it is comfortable. And it’s engineered with IP68 protection1, so it’s safe even if it goes for a dip in the water. Featuring the widest aperture available in a smartphone, the advanced 50MP camera lets you capture stunning photos in any light. Plus, get power for the day in just 10 minutes with 68W TurboPower™ charging. Immerse yourself in entertainment on the borderless 6.6" pOLED display. And listen with cinema-quality Dolby Atmos® sound. You’ll also experience powerful performance, fueling everything from smoother games to higher resolution videos. All while enjoying Android the way it was intended, along with convenient, intuitive moto gesture controls. Make a splash with motorola edge.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great phone! I really did my research and am very happy with it
reviews.reviewText: This Motorola Edge 2023 New is an excellent phone. It is fast and clean. It has a wonderful camera with clear and beautiful pics. I just took pics of the blizzard, Gerri in Michigan and they are really nice! I wanted reliable and a good camera and I got both. I have plenty of storage, fast game play, really cool wallpaper icon, display, font, theme, color personalization. I'm really enjoying this phone. I have had all Iphones, S23 ultra and many androids in my life. This is a good and solid phone. I wanted less of a price tag than the Iphone and highest price flagships, so I chose this one. It updated just fine. I'm at Android 13. If you want a great phone and still want to keep some money... buy this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent phone for the price - good value
reviews.reviewText: I bought this phone to replace an older 4G phone. It's quite a bit slimmer and lighter. While I wasn't prepared for how much smaller overall the screen is, I am pleased with how nice it is. Video and screen quality is great. Brightness is sufficient, even outdoors. The phone fits a hand or pocket nicely, and the curved edges are just pleasing. It hasn't gotten warm to the touch like my old phone, even when using data and GPS to navigate.The GPS for some reason is SO much more accurate than that on my old phone (which may have to do with Android 13 instead of 9). I love having accurate location information when using the map applications.When resting on its back on a surface like a tabletop, due to the camera lenses on the back it rocks annoyingly when you touch the screen. I used a small rubber foot with Gorilla Glue to even it out on the back. With this mod, the phone is easy to use one-handed on a hard surface but still slips easily into and out of a pocket without snagging.The camera is much better than my old phone's, and the Android 13 and Motorola software makes it easier to take good pictures (I am no great photographer).Sound quality is good from such tiny speakers, and using the phone as ... well ... a phone is just fine. When I listen to music it's with Bluetooth headphones, and they connect easily. Speaking of networking, WiFi just works without histrionics, and the 5G cell data is just fine.I uninstalled quite a few applications after the first setup. I believe this, coupled with using the battery saver feature and restricting apps background data use, helps with battery life. The battery lasts all day; I'm typically at 40-50% by bedtime, but I don't do gaming or movies besides the occasional YouTube clip. You must buy your own charge - the phone does not come with one. Motorola recommends a 68W fast charger, so I bought an Amazon Basics one off this site, which charges it from 80% to 100% in less than 1/2 hour.I haven't dropped it (yet) so I can't tell you about durability ;) .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Power Adapter Missing
reviews.reviewText: Phone may work good, when I will use only then share true experience. But would have been nice to get the 68 watt power adapter with the phone. It is clearly mentioned on the Product details in the amazon description that in the box includes power adapter, charging cable and SIM card tool kit. And I got without power adapter.Bad quality service delivery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great phone & found a CASE that fits
reviews.reviewText: I'm really loving this phone!Everything works smoother and faster compared to previous Motorola phones that I've had.I'll write more about it after I've used it for a week or 2. Maybe. I already agree with the reviewers that spelled out what they like about this phone.My main purpose of writing this review is to let you know that I found a nice case that fits except for 1 minor adjustment that it needs.The black case I found called 'Aikcks for Motorola Edge 40 5G' (as far as dimensions and snug fit) is a perfect fit and actually quite stylish. It's not just a nice black, it's sweet looking.However, you will need to make a very small opening for the proximity sensor. The new opening will need to be made on the top/left/upper side of the *case*.Note: The case already has an opening on the top/right/upper side. Probably for a slightly different Edge phone... obviously.I used a very small drill bit 1/32" (I think that was the size) and increased the size of the new opening gradually until I got it approx 1/8" round. I don't know what material this case is made of, but it's strong, flexible & durable.Just under $7. A great price for sure and if you mess it up by not being careful creating the new opening, you won't mind ordering another. 😎

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice phone, hard to find case
reviews.reviewText: This phone was purchased for my husband and he seems to like it so far. I wanted to address the issue of how hard it was to find cases and screen protectors for it. After hours of research, I found that the Motorola Edge 40 is the exact same size as this phone. I purchased 3 different cases that are for the Edge 40 and they fit Motorola Edge 2023 perfectly. The screen protector is also a good fit. Hope this helps others feel less stressed about finding accessories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Phone is straight up crap.
reviews.reviewText: After setting the phone up and allowing it to download all the apps from my older Motorola (2022). It would not recognize the pin. It would recognize the fingerprint but then asked for the pin for additional security. Spent way to much time trying to correct this problem. Resetting the phone to factory settings ect. I have decided to use it as target practice and continue using my older phone which doesn't work well with 5g. But it does work. No more Motorola for me.
